%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% Textclass specific LaTeX commands.
\numberwithin{equation}{section}
\numberwithin{figure}{section}
\theoremstyle{plain}
\newtheorem{thm}{\protect\theoremname}
  \theoremstyle{definition}
  \newtheorem{xca}[thm]{\protect\exercisename}
  \newcounter{casectr}
  \newenvironment{caseenv}
  {\begin{list}{{\itshape\ \protect\casename} \arabic{casectr}.}{%
   \setlength{\leftmargin}{\labelwidth}
   \addtolength{\leftmargin}{\parskip}
   \setlength{\itemindent}{\listparindent}
   \setlength{\itemsep}{\medskipamount}
   \setlength{\topsep}{\itemsep}}
   \setcounter{casectr}{0}
   \usecounter{casectr}}
  {\end{list}}

\makeatother

\usepackage{babel}
  \providecommand{\casename}{Case}
  \providecommand{\exercisename}{Exercise}
\providecommand{\theoremname}{Theorem}

\begin{document}
\global\long\def\e{\mathrm{e}}



\section{Lower bound on tree depth}

The entropy argument can be written as
\[
\log\binom{k+d}{k}\le k\log\left(1+d/k\right)+d\log\left(1+k/d\right)
\]

\begin{xca}
\label{ex:simple}$c\log\left(1+1/c\right)$ is growing from $[1;1]$
to $[\infty;\log\e]$, so $c\log\left(1+1/c\right)\le\log\e$. Proof
is simple~-- growth by derivation, limit by L'Hospital.\end{xca}
\begin{caseenv}
\item $k\ge d\ge2$, denote $c:=k/d\ge1$. From the above we have
\begin{eqnarray*}
\log n & \le & cd\log\left(1+1/c\right)+d\log\left(1+c\right)=d\left[\left(1+c\right)\log\left(1+c\right)-c\log c\right]=\\
 & = & d\left[\log\left(1+c\right)+c\log\left(1+1/c\right)\right]\overset{ex.\,\ref{ex:simple}}{\le}d\log\left(\e\left(1+c\right)\right)
\end{eqnarray*}
 As a consequence we have a very tight bound
\[
d\ge\frac{\log n}{\log\left(\e\left(1+c\right)\right)}=\frac{\log n}{\log\left(\e\left(1+k/d\right)\right)}
\]
Now we use the inequality on itself (what a cheat!) and we use that
$1+c=1+k/d\le k$
\[
d\ge\frac{\log n}{\log\left(\e\left(1+k\frac{\log\left(\e\left(1+c\right)\right)}{\log n}\right)\right)}\ge\frac{\log n}{\log\e+\log\left(1+k\frac{\log\left(\e k\right)}{\log n}\right)}
\]
\end{caseenv}

\end{document}
